title: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Management
content: COPD management focuses on reducing symptoms and exacerbation risk. Smoking cessation is the most effective intervention. Pharmacotherapy includes bronchodilators (SABA, LABA, LAMA) and inhaled corticosteroids based on symptom severity and exacerbation history. Pulmonary rehabilitation improves exercise capacity and quality of life. Oxygen therapy is indicated for patients with severe resting hypoxemia.
